query: What is the capital of France?

candidates.text: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.
London is the capital of England and the United Kingdom.
Berlin is the capital and largest city of Germany.
The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.
France is a country located in Western Europe.
Photosynthesis is the process used by plants, algae, and cyanobacteria to convert light energy into chemical energy.
Cellular respiration is a set of metabolic reactions and processes that take place in the cells of organisms to convert biochemical energy from nutrients into adenosine triphosphate (ATP).
Chlorophyll is a green pigment found in cyanobacteria and the chloroplasts of algae and plants.
The water cycle describes the continuous movement of water on, above, and below the surface of the Earth.
